member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.After(HtmlTags.HtmlTag)
member.summary: Inserts a sibling tag immediately after the current tag. Any existing sibling will follow the inserted tag.
member.param: The tag to add as a sibling

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.After
member.summary: Returns the sibling tag that immediately follows the current tag. Same as .

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Creates nested child tags and returns the innermost tag. Use if you want to return the parent tag.
member.param: One or more HTML element names separated by a / or >
member.returns: The innermost tag that was newly added

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Add(System.String,System.Action{HtmlTags.HtmlTag})
member.summary: Creates nested child tags and returns the innermost tag after running on it. Use if you want to return the parent tag.
member.param: One or more HTML element names separated by a / or >
Modifications to perform on the newly added innermost tag
member.returns: The innermost tag that was newly added

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Add``1
member.summary: Creates a tag of and adds it as a child. Returns the created child tag.

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Append(HtmlTags.HtmlTag)
member.summary: Adds the given tag as the last child of the parent, and returns the parent.
member.param: The tag to add as a child of the parent.

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Append(System.String)
member.summary: Creates nested child tags and returns the tag on which the method was called. Use if you want to return the innermost tag.
member.param: One or more HTML element names separated by a / or >
member.returns: The instance on which the method was called (the parent of the new tags)

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Append(System.String,System.Action{HtmlTags.HtmlTag})
member.summary: Creates nested child tags, runs on the innermost tag, and returns the tag on which the method was called. Use if you want to return the innermost tag.

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Append(HtmlTags.ITagSource)
member.summary: Adds all tags from as children of the current tag. Returns the parent tag.
member.param: The source of tags to add as children.

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Append(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{HtmlTags.HtmlTag})
member.summary: Adds a sequence of tags as children of the current tag. Returns the parent tag.
member.param: A sequence of tags to add as children.

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Data(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Stores a value in an HTML5 custom data attribute
member.param: The name of the data attribute. Will have "data-" prepended when rendered.
The value to store. Non-string values will be JSON encoded.

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Data``1(System.String,System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Modifies an existing reference value stored in an HTML5 custom data
member.typeparam: The type of the data stored in the given location
member.param: The name of the data storage location
The action to perform on the currently stored value

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Data(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value stored in HTML5 custom data
member.param: The name of the data storage location

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.MetaData(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Stores multiple JSON-encoded key/value pairs in a the "data-:" attribute. Useful when used with the jquery.metadata plugin
member.param: The name of the stored value

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.MetaData``1(System.String,System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Modifies an existing reference value stored in MetaData
member.typeparam: The type of the stored value
member.param: The name of the stored value
The action to perform on the currently stored value

member.name: M:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.MetaData(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the MetaData value stored for a given key.
member.param: The name of the stored value

member.name: P:HtmlTags.HtmlTag.Next
member.summary: The sibling tag that immediately follows the current tag. Setting this value will remove any existing value. Use if you wish to insert a new sibling before any existing sibling.

member.name: M:HtmlTags.JsonUtil.ToUnsafeJson(System.Object)
member.summary: Allows you to use function names (via ) in the value of a property, which is against the JSON spec
